Tewatia hit five sixes in 18th over bowled by Cottrell to help his then team RR win by four wickets.

177.title: Lion mauls 5-year-old girl to death in Gujarat's Amreli
177.article_body: Forest officials said that a five-year-old girl was mauled to death by a lion in Gujarat's Amreli, after which the lion was caught and taken to an animal care centre. The victim was the daughter of a farm labourer from Rajasthan. She was playing in the village when the lion attacked her and dragged her, the officials added.

178.title: BJP sent demolition notice to 4 Delhi temples to extort money: Atishi
178.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the BJP-led Central government posted demolition notices on the walls of four temples in Delhi in order to extort money. She said that the BJP government had issued the order to demolish the Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Sriniwaspuri and a similar order has now been issued against four temples of Sarojini Nagar.

179.title: Stash of arms, ammunition including AK-56 recovered from Arunachal
179.article_body: A huge cache of arms, ammunition and explosives were recovered by the Indian army from Arunachal Pradesh's Changlang district on Tuesday. Police said that 14 Rajput Regiment recovered the arms and ammunition from the forest area of Phinbiro-I, suspected to be hidden by a proscribed outfit. One AK-56 rifle, two SBML guns were among the recovered ammunition.

180.title: Thieves steal jewellery, cash worth ₹1.5 lakh from parked car in MP
180.article_body: A bag containing jewellery and cash worth about ₹1.5 lakh was stolen from a car in MP's Ujjain on Monday. The owner had parked his car outside the premises of a building where he had gone to attend a wedding ceremony. A family member found the window broken and valuables missing after she returned to the car around 3 pm.

181.title: Jared Leto & Gucci's Alessandro Michele twin at Met Gala 2022
181.article_body: Actor Jared Leto twinned with Gucci designer Alessandro Michele at the Met Gala 2022. The duo donned the same tuxedos, clutches, hair clips and sunglasses while posing for cameras together at the event. Leto and Michele also wore the same red bow ties, black gloves and shoes. Last year, Leto carried a replica of his head at the Met Gala.

182.title: Table-toppers GT to bat first against PBKS, both teams unchanged
182.article_body: Table-toppers Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are playing with unchanged playing XIs. GT have won five matches in a row, while PBKS are currently eighth on the points table with four wins from nine matches.

183.title: My free speech banned over Kashmir Files, I'm victim of hate campaign: Vivek
183.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has shared a video on Twitter claiming that he is a "victim of a hate campaign" and his "free speech was banned" over 'The Kashmir Files'. He said that a group of foreign journalists had invited him to address a press conference but it was cancelled after some members of "powerful media" took "strong objection" to it.

184.title: Won't celebrate Eid this year, my mom is in ICU: Zareen Khan
184.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan has stated that she will not celebrate Eid this year since her mother is in the ICU. Zareen added it will be Eid for her when her mother returns home. "I used to eagerly wait for Eid as a child...It was a huge thing to receive ₹100 (as Eidi) and I'd always save the money," she said.

185.title: Madras HC summons Dhanush after couple claims he is their son
185.article_body: Actor Dhanush has been summoned by the Madras High Court after a couple moved the court claiming that he is their son. Kathiseran and his wife Meenakshi have claimed that Dhanush had submitted forged documents of paternity test. Their case was earlier dismissed in 2020 saying that there were no supporting documents to prove that the paternity documents were forged.

186.title: Will support Sweden & Finland if they apply to join NATO: Germany
186.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday that the country will back Finland and Sweden's potential bid for NATO membership, adding that no one can assume Russia won't attack other countries. "[Putin] wants to expand his territory...push borders with violence," he added. Scholz's remarks come amid reports that Sweden and Finland are likely to apply for NATO membership in May.

187.title: Man tries to set police chowky on fire in Mumbai's Mira Road; arrested
187.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for trying to burn down a police chowky in the Shanti Park area of Mumbai's Mira Road. The accused, Sunny Sadanand Kadam, used petrol from the fuel tank of one of the patrolling bikes to set the chowky on fire. Passers-by not only doused the fire but also caught Kadam on the spot.

188.title: Actor Oscar Isaac wears a dress at Met Gala, his wife Elvira wears a suit; fans react
188.article_body: Marvel's Moon Knight actor Oscar Isaac attended the Met Gala wearing a white tie and tails tailored dress, while his filmmaker-wife Elvira Lind wore a suit. Both of them wore outfits designed by Thom Browne. "Looking super stylish...love seeing men in skirts," an Instagram user commented. "Well played, they both look stunning," another comment read

189.title: Mumbai Police seizes loudspeakers from MNS office, detains Chandivali party unit chief
189.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday seized loudspeakers from the office of Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in Chandivali and detained party's unit chief Mahendra Bhanushali, among other leaders. Police have also issued notices to at least 100 people. The move comes after Thackeray asked people to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there were not removed.

190.title: Shivaji memorial at Raigad Fort wasn't built by Lokmanya Tilak: Sambhaji
190.article_body: BJP MP Sambhaji Chhatrapati has reacted to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's statement that Lokmanya Tilak built Chhatrapati Shivaji's memorial at Raigad Fort near Pune. "I can state with some authority that Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's memorial was not built by Lokmanya Tilak," he said. Sambhaji is a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and the great-grandson of Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj.

191.title: 4 men arrested for ATM card cloning in Mumbai
191.article_body: At least four men were arrested by the Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar (MBVV) police for cloning ATM cards and withdrawing money. Acting on secret information, the police arrested Saurabh Yadav, who informed them about his three aides, leading to their arrest. Three laptops, four ATM card cloners, eight ATM card skimming devices and five mobile phones were recovered from the accused.

192.title: Delhi Police arrests 114, recover 4.6 kg of drugs in last 24 hrs
192.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 114 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 4.6 kilograms of narcotics substances in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 12 proclaimed offenders, seized 174 quarters of illicit liquor and recovered 19 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 5,422 calls, the post added.

193.title: People in Delhi used to taunt us saying 'Sachin and his parents are going': Sanju Samson
193.article_body: Cricketer Sanju Samson recalled how his parents used to face taunts during his earlier days in Delhi. "Our parents used to carry...our kit bags as [me and my brother] were very young. People would remark 'Sachin and his parents are going...He'll become Tendulkar'," he said. Samson added, "A lot of fun was made at them like this...but they were confident."

194.title: DC's 22-year-old opener Prithvi Shaw buys apartment in Mumbai for ₹10.5 crore: Report
194.article_body: DC opener Prithvi Shaw has bought a flat in Mumbai's Bandra West for ₹10.5 crore, Moneycontrol reported. The unit with a 2,209-sq ft carpet area and a terrace of 1,654-sq ft was registered on April 28, the report added. The 22-year-old cricketer, who has scored 259 runs in IPL 2022 so far, was retained by DC for ₹7.5 crore.

195.title: Denmark PM gives PM Modi tour of her house, pics show painting he gifted her last year
195.article_body: After receiving PM Narendra Modi at the Copenhagen airport on Tuesday, Danish PM Mette Frederiksen gave him a tour of her official residence. She also showed the Pattachitra painting from Odisha gifted by PM Modi during her visit to India last year. Both the Prime Ministers also addressed a joint press meet.

196.title: Maratha Mandir executive director refuses to screen 'Doctor Strange 2'
196.article_body: G7 multiplex and Maratha Mandir Cinema's executive director, Manoj Desai, refused to screen 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. He stated the booker of their cinema had said the film will be given to them if they increase the ticket fee by ₹30. "Managing director of our cinema isn't in favour of increasing rates by even ₹1," he added.

197.title: MNS bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maha: Sanjay Raut
197.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that Maharashtra Navnirman Sena bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maharashtra. "The government must find out the political party that has given the contract to the 'Hindu Owaisi' to disturb the peace and harmony in the state. The government is standing on solid footing," Raut said.

198.title: 24 Rohingyas, including 10 children, held in Tripura
198.article_body: The Tripura Police on Tuesday said that 24 Rohingya immigrants, including 10 children, were detained in the state's Unakoti district on Monday. The BSF had intercepted the migrants in three cars near a checkpoint, they added. The Rohingyas, who had arrived in the state from Jammu, were planning to cross into Bangladesh through the border at Kailashahar, according to sources.

199.title: Hope to swiftly conclude talks on India-EU Free Trade Agreement: PM
199.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he hopes that negotiations on the India-EU Free Trade Agreement will be concluded swiftly. Speaking at the joint press meet with Danish PM Mette Frederiksen, PM Modi said, "We stressed on the need to ensure a free, open, inclusive and rules-based Indo-Pacific region." We also appealed for a ceasefire in Ukraine, he added.

200.title: Like US & Israel, India now retaliates if someone meddles with our borders: Shah
200.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that like US and Israel, India now retaliates whenever someone meddles with our borders. "Earlier only two nations, the United States of America and Israel, used to retaliate whenever someone meddled with their borders and military. Now due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, our great nation India has joined that group," he stated.

201.title: Fan asks Kartik why he was in economy not business class, he responds
201.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a video showing clips of him promoting his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. He could be seen sitting in the economy class of an Indigo aircraft on his way to Chandigarh. A fan commented, "Why Kartik Aaryan not travelled in business class?" to which Kartik responded, "Ticket mehengi thi (Ticket was expensive)."

202.title: Ex-Cong MLA Ashwin Kotwal joins BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
202.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, former Congress MLA Ashwin Kotwal joined the BJP on Tuesday. The ex-Khedbrahma MLA tendered his resignation to the Gujarat Legislative Assembly Speaker Nimaben Acharya earlier today. Kotwal, who hails from the tribal community, said that he was "very upset" with Congress, adding that the party "pretends to be within tribal society".

203.title: India's GDP to not reach $5 trillion before FY29: IMF data
203.article_body: India may only become a $5-trillion economy in FY29, data from IMF's World Economic Outlook Database suggested. As per the data, which doesn't go beyond FY28, India's nominal GDP is seen rising to $4.92 trillion in FY28. Earlier this year, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran had said India would become a $5-trillion economy by FY26 or the following year.

204.title: LIC IPO undervalued, shares being offered at throwaway prices: Cong
204.article_body: Congress General Secretary Randeep Surjewala on Tuesday said the LIC IPO is undervalued and that shares are being offered at throwaway prices. Surjewala also asked why LIC's valuation was reduced from ₹12-14 lakh crore to ₹6 lakh crore in just two months. "Why is government trying to sell LIC when domestic and global financial markets are in turmoil?" Surjewala said.

205.title: If Mohsin keeps working hard, he'll become a very good player: Gambhir
205.article_body: Calling Mohsin Khan a "standout player", LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said the pacer's "unbelievable" bowling spell of 4-0-16-4 turned the match in their favour against DC in IPL 2022. "If the guy [Mohsin] keeps working hard, he would probably become a very good player," he added. Mohsin was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in LSG's six-run win over DC.

206.title: Tickets in Hyd's 1st class suburban trains to be cheaper by 50% from May 5
206.article_body: A 50% cut in the basic first-class ticket fares has been announced in Hyderabad's suburban MMTS (multi-modal transport system) train network from May 5 (Thursday). The minimum charge for up to 10 km will now be ₹25 as compared to ₹50 earlier. The maximum fare for 36-45 km distance has been reduced to ₹90 from ₹155.

207.title: BJP bulldozing India's secular nature, making mini-Pakistans: Mufti
207.article_body: BJP is "bulldozing the secular nature of the country and in the process making many Pakistans within India", said former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti. "They have failed on all fronts, whether it is employment or inflation, the only thing they are using now is the Hindu-Muslim divide," she said. They have no vision for the county, she added.

208.title: India appealed to take path of dialogues for solution in Ukraine: PM in Denmark
208.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Copenhagen, Denmark said India made an appeal to take the path of dialogues and strategy for an immediate ceasefire and solution to the problem in Ukraine. He was speaking at the joint press meet with Danish PM Mette Frederiksen. PM Modi added that over 200 Danish companies are working in different sectors in India.

209.title: Thane police books woman for cheating 12 railway job aspirants of ₹59 lakh
209.article_body: Police in Thane have registered a case against a woman for allegedly cheating 12 people of ₹59 lakh after promising them jobs in the Railways. The woman had given appointment letters to the victims in sealed envelopes. When the job aspirants reported for work at the Central Railway's office, they were told the appointment letters were fake, an officer said.

210.title: I try to push limits to see what I'm capable of: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya
210.article_body: Wrestler Ravi Kumar Dahiya, who became India's first-ever three-time Asian champion, said since he's young (24-year-old), he tries to push the limits to see what he's capable of as he doesn't want to have any regrets later. The Tokyo Olympics silver medallist won his third consecutive gold in 57kg category at 2022 Asian Championships in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, last month.

211.title: 'Jai Bhim' wins Best Film at Dadasaheb Phalke Int'l Film Festival
211.article_body: Actor Suriya's 'Jai Bhim' has won the award for Best Feature Film at the 12th Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival. Actor Manikandan also won the award for Best Supporting Actor for his role in the film. "Thank you @dadasahebfest for the honour," 2D Entertainment tweeted. The film was also sent to the Oscars, however, it did not earn a nomination.

212.title: Merchandise exports rise 24.2% to $38 bn in April, imports grow 26.6%
212.article_body: India's merchandise exports rose 24.22% YoY from $30.75 billion in April 2021 to $38.19 billion in April 2022, Commerce Ministry's preliminary data showed. Imports in April 2022 grew 26.55% YoY to $58.26 billion while trade deficit widened to $20.07 billion against $15.29 billion in April 2021. Petroleum and crude products accounted for 33.5% of imports in April this year.

213.title: Putin has to end the killings, I hope India will influence Russia: Denmark PM
213.article_body: Speaking about Russia-Ukraine war on Tuesday, Danish PM Mette Frederiksen said, "My message is very clear- Putin has to stop this war and end the killings. I hope that India will influence Russia also in this discussion." Frederiksen said this while issuing a statement at a joint press meet with PM Narendra Modi during his first visit to Denmark.

214.title: BJP leading double lives with beer in teapots: Mahua on Rahul's video
214.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra reacted to criticism after Congress' Rahul Gandhi was seen at a nightclub in Nepal. "How on earth is it anybody’s business whether Rahul...or anybody else is in nightclub or at wedding in private time?" she asked. "Sick BJP trolls...should stick to doing what they do best- leading double lives with beer in teapots," she added.

215.title: Special gesture: India as Denmark PM personally comes to receive PM Modi at airport
215.article_body: After Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen personally came to receive PM Narendra Modi at the Copenhagen airport on Tuesday, External Affairs Ministry's Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "Heartwarming to see this special gesture from our Green Partner." It is PM Modi's first visit to Denmark, where he will hold bilateral and multilateral talks.

216.title: Ahead of PM Modi's visit, France's Naval Group backs out of key submarine project
216.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Paris, France's Naval Group said it's unable to participate in Centre's P-75(I) project, under which 6 conventional submarines are to be domestically built for Indian Navy. "The present Request of Proposal requires that the fuel cell AIP (air independent propulsion)...be sea proven...The French Navy doesn't use such propulsion system," an official stated.

217.title: It's a free country: Musk on potential exodus of Twitter employees
217.article_body: Elon Musk said it's a "free country" after he was asked about a potential exodus of Twitter employees following his takeover on Met Gala's red carpet. "Certainly if anyone doesn't feel comfortable...they'll on their own accord go somewhere else. That's fine," Musk stated. As per Guardian, Twitter workers had raised questions about job security at a recently held company-wide meeting.

218.title: India's richest man's Adani Wilmar buys several brands including 'Kohinoor' rice
218.article_body: India's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Wilmar announced the acquisition of several brands, including the 'Kohinoor' brand from McCormick Switzerland GMBH. The financial details of the deal were undisclosed. The deal gives Adani Wilmar exclusive rights over the 'Kohinoor' basmati rice brand and 'Ready to Cook', 'Ready to Eat' curries & meals portfolio under the Kohinoor Brand umbrella in India.

219.title: Musk planning to put less of his money into buying Twitter: Report
219.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion last month, is "tying up less of his wealth in the deal", Reuters reported. Musk is in talks with large investment firms and high net-worth individuals for the financing. The new financing, if secured, could reduce the $21 billion cash contribution committed by Musk.

220.title: Taiwan reduces quarantine for arrivals amid spike in COVID-19 cases
220.article_body: Taiwan said on Tuesday that it'll reduce mandatory quarantine period from 10 days to seven days for all arrivals from May 9 onwards. Additionally, arriving passengers will have to take an RT-PCR test upon reaching the country. The announcement comes at a time when Taiwan's experiencing a surge in COVID-19 cases with 23,139 new infections reported in last 24 hours.

221.title: Revise timings or advance summer holidays: Parents to Delhi govt
221.article_body: Parents have urged the Delhi government to either revise school hours or advance the summer vacation in view of extreme heat conditions. "During peak summer hours, students are out in the sun, which is really dangerous," said Delhi Parents Association President Aparajita Gautam. Preponing summer vacations isn't an option as schools have opened after a long period, a parent said.

222.title: Railways spent ₹150 cr to repair 2,000 wagons to transport coal
222.article_body: The Indian Railways has spent around ₹150 crore since January to repair over 2,000 wagons to expedite the transportation of coal to power plants, according to officials. An official claimed that the damage was caused by JCBs used by private contractors to unload coal at power plants. Currently, there is a power crisis in the country, leading to blackouts.

223.title: SRK is great: Benedict on his choice for Indian actor in MCU
223.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch, in a recent interview, was asked which Indian actor could play a superhero in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The British actor was given an option between Shah Rukh Khan and Hrithik Roshan. To this, Benedict replied, "[Shah Rukh] Khan is great." Earlier, Benedict spoke about India and said he loves the country and its cultures.

224.title: China sends aircraft carrier, vessels to seas near Japan
224.article_body: Japanese Defence Ministry said that eight Chinese Navy vessels, including an aircraft carrier and destroyers, sailed between Japan's Okinawa island and Miyakojima on Monday. However, the ministry added, there was no incursion into Japan's territorial waters. Reportedly, it is the first time that a Chinese aircraft carrier was confirmed to have passed through the area since December 2021.

225.title: FIR against Raj Thackeray over his speech at Aurangabad rally
225.article_body: A case has been registered against MNS chief Raj Thackeray over his speech at a public rally in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on May 1. The organisers of the rally have also been named in the FIR filed in Aurangabad. In the rally, Thackeray had asked his supporters to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there weren't removed.

226.title: Man Utd would be 15th-16th or even lower in PL without Ronaldo: Ferdinand
226.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said Manchester United would have been placed on the 15th or 16th position, or even lower in the Premier League this season, in the absence of Cristiano Ronaldo. "I will be absolutely shocked to the hilt if [new manager] Erik ten Hag comes in and says he can't work with Ronaldo," added Ferdinand.

227.title: Taliban tells driving teachers to stop issuing licences to women: Report
227.article_body: Taliban officials in Afghanistan's Herat have verbally instructed driving teachers to stop issuing licences to women, AFP reported. However, we've "not been directed to stop women from driving in the city", Jan Achakzai, head of Herat's Traffic Management Institute that oversees driving schools, said. Taliban has implemented new rules to restrict women's rights in Afghanistan since seizing power.

228.title: Maha police personnel's leaves cancelled amid Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker warning
228.article_body: Maharashtra DGP Rajneesh Seth on Tuesday, while appealing to citizens to maintain peace, informed that leaves of police personnel have been cancelled in view of the ongoing law and order situation in the state. MNS chief Raj Thackeray's speech calling for removal of loudspeakers from mosques is being looked into and legal action will be taken if needed, Seth added.

229.title: Russia claims it hit Ukraine logistics centre having US weapons
229.article_body: Russia has struck a military airfield near Ukraine's southwestern city of Odesa with missiles, the Russian Defence Ministry said on Tuesday. "Hangars containing unmanned Bayraktar TB2 drones as well as missiles and ammunition from the US and European countries were destroyed," it added. Russian missiles and artillery also hit several military targets across Ukraine, including command centres.

230.title: 1 arrested, 5 booked over child marriage in Rajasthan's Jhalawar
230.article_body: Rajasthan Police arrested one person and booked five others for allegedly arranging a child marriage in Rajasthan's Jhalawar last week. The matter came to light when a video clip of the minor couple entering into wedlock surfaced, police said. Accordingly, a case was registered against the accused under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act, 2006.

231.title: Prisons shouldn't become centres for anti-national activities: MHA
231.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has written to all the states and Union Territories and their prison authorities to take effective steps to prevent prisons from becoming breeding grounds for anti-national activities. For this, the Ministry issued an order suggesting a regular inspection of prisons. Moreover, it also stressed on the need to strengthen security arrangements.

232.title: In our eyes we have found the best playing XI: KKR's Nitish Rana
232.article_body: Reacting to the criticism over the frequent changes in their playing XI, KKR batter Nitish Rana said if they keep winning, then any XI is the best. He added, "In our eyes, we've got the best XI, probably the outsiders feel that we haven't. The comfortable way in which we won [against RR]...means our playing XI is set," he added.

233.title: Wish my wife & kids had met you: Sanjay Dutt on Nargis' death anniversary
233.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt penned a note for his mother late actress Nargis on social media to mark her death anniversary. He wrote, "Not a single moment goes by when I don't remember you. Ma, you were the basis of my life and the strength of my soul. I wish my wife and kids would have met you."

234.title: Amazon to pay US staff travel expenses of up to $4,000 for abortions
234.article_body: Amazon will cover up to $4,000 per year in travel costs for US employees seeking non-life threatening medical treatments, including elective abortion and transgender care. As per the announcement, the benefits will apply to treatments that are not available inside a 100-mile radius of an employee's home. This comes amid rising restrictions for abortion procedures in the US.

235.title: Rajasthan CM instructs officials to head to Jodhpur following violence
235.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday convened high-level meeting with state's DGP, other officials on law and order situation following violence in Jodhpur. Gehlot directed officials, including Jodhpur in-charge Minister Dr Subhash Garg, to immediately head to city. Curfew has been imposed in 10 areas of Jodhpur as clashes broke out between two communities at Jalori Gate after Eid prayers.

236.title: Steps being taken in higher education to empower youth, says Amit Shah
236.article_body: Addressing the students of Nrupathunga University on Tuesday in Bengaluru, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is building infrastructure for higher education such that India's youth can stand at par with global levels. "The future of any country is built by the youth and their character," he added.

237.title: DCW rescues 5 minor boys from bangle making unit in Delhi
237.article_body: Five minor boys employed as child labour at a bangle making unit in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area were rescued by Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Monday. According to DCW, the children hailed from Bihar and had come to the national capital over a month ago to earn livelihood. "The boys...were beaten up frequently and mercilessly by their employer," DCW said.

238.title: Domestic mutual funds subscribe 71% of LIC IPO anchor book
238.article_body: Domestic mutual funds invested ₹4,002.27 crore, accounting for 71.12% of the total ₹5,627 crore that LIC IPO mobilised from anchor investors on Monday. The largest investor was SBI Mutual Fund, which invested ₹1,006.89 crore. Overall, LIC issued 59.29 million equity shares to 123 anchor investors at the upper price band of the offer of ₹949 per share.

239.title: Many times Lata didi felt she's an orphan: Hridaynath Mangeshkar
239.article_body: Speaking about her sister, late singer Lata Mangeshkar, Hridaynath Mangeshkar said, "Lata Mangeshkar didn't become Lata Mangeshkar just like that. She had to go through a lot...There were...many times she used to feel that she's an orphan, she has no one," he added. "And the way she stood up after being...broken is what makes her a legend," he added.

240.title: If they've a good story, I'll be there: Olsen on potential Scarlet Witch movie
240.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen, on being asked if Scarlet Witch will ever get a solo movie, said, "I don't know, but if they have a good story to tell, I'll be there." She made her Marvel Cinematic Universe debut in 2014 in the post-credit scene of 'Captain America: The Winter Soldier'. Olsen played one of the leads in the web series 'WandaVision'.

241.title: BJP leader Satish Poonia slams Congress over Rajasthan's law & order situation
241.article_body: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia slammed Congress-led state government over disrupted law and order situation in the state and said, "Why does this type of incident happen only during Congress rule?" Referring to violent incidents that took place on Ram Navami and Eid-ul-Fitr in Karauli and Jodhpur respectively, Poonia said, "Due to appeasement politics, peace...has been disturbed in the state."

242.title: Rival gang members attack man with beer bottles, machete inside Mysuru bar
242.article_body: Five members of a gang have been booked for attacking a rival gang member with beer bottles and a machete inside a bar in Karnataka's Mysuru. According to a police officer, the gang had an old rivalry with the victim, who is also a rowdy-sheeter. Two of the accused were arrested after CCTV camera captured the incident, police said.

243.title: Heard's op-ed piece on abuse was catastrophic for Depp's career: Actor's agent
243.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-wife Amber Heard's 2018 op-ed piece about being a victim of domestic violence was "catastrophic" for his career, Depp's agent Jack Whigham told the jury on Monday in the defamation trial brought by the actor. He said Depp struggled to get any kind of work and had to take a pay cut to do the independent film 'Minamata'.

244.title: We're friends; we have healthy relationship: Terence on rumours of dating Nora
244.article_body: Choreographer Terence Lewis opened up about the rumours of him dating actress Nora Fatehi. He said, "We are very good friends," adding that there's nothing more to it. "I think we have got great chemistry on-screen. Most importantly, she is a very free-spirited person, and I also like her energy and vibe...We have a very healthy relationship," Terence said.

245.title: We're in a crisis, we've to make responsible choices: Bhumi on climate change
245.article_body: Speaking about climate change, actress Bhumi Pednekar said she doesn't use single use plastic in her daily life. "We're in a crisis, and...we've reached a tipping point. We've seen so many climate-related disasters in the last few years," she added. "We all have to make many conscious and responsible choices," Bhumi said.

246.title: The selectors are watching: Aakash on Shubman Gill's form in IPL 2022
246.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said GT opener Shubman Gill needs to start scoring in the ongoing IPL season as the selectors are watching. "GT are managing without big scores from Shubman...which is not a good thing for him," stated Aakash. So far, Shubman has scored 260 runs, crossing the fifty-run mark only twice in nine games.

247.title: India ranks 150 out of 180 nations on World Press Freedom Index; falls 8 spots
247.article_body: India has been ranked 150 on the 2022 edition of the World Press Freedom Index published by the international organisation Reporters Without Borders. India had ranked 142 in 2020 and 2021 on the index, which assesses the state of journalism in 180 countries and territories. Pakistan has been ranked 157 and China 175, while Norway has ranked 1.

248.title: Murray registers 1st win on clay in nearly 2 years, beats Thiem in Madrid
248.article_body: Wild card Andy Murray, playing in his first tournament on clay in nearly two years, defeated ex-world number three Dominic Thiem 6-3, 6-4 in first round at 2022 Madrid Open on Monday. Two-time champion Murray will face 14th-seeded Denis Shapovalov, who beat lucky loser Ugo Humbert of France, 7-6(7-1), 6-3. Murray played his last clay-court match at 2020 French Open.

249.title: PM Modi defamed past govts, hid BJP's failures in Berlin: Kharge
249.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi for "defaming" past governments in order to hide the "shortcomings and failures" of the BJP-led Central government while addressing the crowd in Berlin during his Europe visit. It is not right for the PM to raise internal issues of India in other countries and criticise past governments, he said.

250.title: Student injured as fan falls on her during exam in Andhra Pradesh
250.article_body: A student at a local school in Andhra Pradesh's Sri Sathyasai district was injured after a ceiling fan fell on her while she was writing her examination. The girl was rushed to a hospital and rejoined after treatment. "It was an unfortunate incident. A proper installation and thorough maintenance will be carried out again," the school principal said.

251.title: Making funny faces at the Met: World's richest man Musk on his Met Gala video
251.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk responded to his video from the Met Gala, in which he was seen making goofy faces, by tweeting, "Making funny faces at the Met." Twitter account 'DogeDesigner' had shared the video with a tweet saying, "My entire net worth is in hands of this man." Musk attended the Met with his supermodel mother Maye Musk.

252.title: Fiji court rules US can seize Russian-owned superyacht
252.article_body: A Fijian court has given the US permission to seize a superyacht suspected of belonging to Russian oligarch Suleiman Kerimov. The US has imposed sanctions on Kerimov over the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Fiji police detained the Amadea, worth around $325 million, after it arrived in the country following an 18-day voyage across the Pacific from Mexico in mid-April.

253.title: SC directs Lakshadweep admin to include meat in mid-day meals
253.article_body: Supreme Court has directed Lakshadweep administration to continue with Kerala High Court's 2021 order directing it to include meat products in mid-day meals for school children. SC was hearing a plea challenging Lakshadweep administration's decision to close dairy farms and remove meat products from mid-day meals. "Issue notice, returnable in two weeks after the ensuing vacation," SC stated.

254.title: Hindi film industry is not over and it will never be: Lyricist Manoj
254.article_body: Lyricist Manoj Muntashir took to Twitter to share his opinion that the Hindi film industry is not over and it will never be. "It's good to read and know English but the day Hindi filmmakers start speaking in Hindi everyday, the soul of our films will rise," added Manoj in his tweet. "We'll be back with a bang," stated Manoj.

255.title: When Indian actors become successful, they only remember bad past: Amit Sadh
255.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh said that when Indian actors become successful, they only remember their bad pasts. "They don't talk about one good thing...I think they forget that someone (in their journey) did something good, which is why they are where they are. I believe that we as people have become cynical in life," he added.

256.title: Actress quits AMMA committee over inaction against Vijay Babu
256.article_body: Actress Maala Parvathi resigned from AMMA's (Association of Malayalam Movie Artists) internal complaints committee in protest against its inaction against rape-accused Vijay Babu. AMMA refused to take any disciplinary action against Vijay stating, "A person cannot be shown the door...on the sole ground that there is a complaint against him...We also have to protect a member of the association."

257.title: LGBTQ aspect of America Chavez's character is from comics: Kevin
257.article_body: Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige opened up about the LGBTQ origins of MCU superhero America Chavez in the film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "That aspect of America's character is from the comics. We always want to adapt them as well and...truthfully as we can," Feige stated. America Chavez, in the comics, is a lesbian character.

258.title: Will ask committee to immediately include Lord Parshuram's chapter in syllabus: MP CM
258.article_body: Addressing an event on occasion of Parshuram Jayanti, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "I'll direct the course committee to immediately include chapter about Lord Parshuram in the syllabus." We have started recruitment of Sanskrit teachers and will ensure that no post for Sanskrit teachers are left vacant so that the work on teaching Sanskrit begins immediately, he added.

259.title: Heavy rainfall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
259.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rainfall in isolated areas of Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Kerala on May 3 and 4. Heavy rainfall is also likely in regions in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on May 5 and over Andaman and Nicobar Islands between May 4 and 7.

260.title: I'm very motivated and excited to be on Khatron Ke Khiladi 12: Rubina
260.article_body:
Actress Rubina Dilaik will be a part of stunt-based show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.
Speaking about it, she said, "I've endured many obstacles in life that...made me stronger and I'm very motivated and excited to be on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi'." "I'm confident that with Rohit Shetty's...guidance, I'll be able to achieve more than [what] I've set for myself," she added.

261.title: Not changing Pushpa 2's script after KGF 2's success: Producer refutes reports
261.article_body: Y Ravi Shankar, producer of Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise', has refuted reports claiming that the film's director Sukumar is making changes to the script of the sequel after the success of 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. "What did KGF 2 do to affect our Pushpa 2? No changes, nothing. We've a high voltage script...why do we need to change...[it]?" Shankar said.

262.title: Car plunges into canal in Greater Noida, 1 dead
262.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after a car he was driving plunged into a canal in Greater Noida on Monday, leaving four others in the vehicle injured. The incident took place after the driver fell asleep at the wheel, the police said. The other passengers were rescued by locals and rushed to a hospital, they added.

263.title: Team of Pune doctors to hold musical event to raise funds for patients
263.article_body: A team of doctors, including a radiologist, an oral cancer surgeon and a paediatric surgeon, will organise a musical event in Pune on May 8 to raise funds for thalassemia patients. The doctors have performed in over 15 cities for various causes such as suicide prevention. They had conducted their first concert titled 'Nostalgia' in 2001.

264.title: 42-yr-old man stabs wife to death for refusing to go to work in TN
264.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed his wife to death in Tamil Nadu's Chennai for refusing to go to work. The wife apparently did so in order to be unable to give the accused money. The accused had got addicted to alcohol and reportedly fought with his wife when she refused to buy it.

265.title: US state stops all executions amid concerns of painful death by injections
265.article_body: The US' Tennessee has halted all executions till the end of 2022 amid concerns of painful death by lethal injections. Governor Bill Lee said an independent review of the procedures will be conducted before any more executions. "The use of the three-drug cocktail is incredibly problematic and in other states, has caused spectacular failures," said a Defence Attorney.

266.title: Mahela Jayawardena names his top 5 players for his dream T20 XI
266.article_body: In a recent episode of 'ICC Review', MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena nominated the first five players he'd pick if he was in charge of selecting a dream T20 side. Jayawardena named Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan as his number one pick, followed by Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi, India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, England wicketkeeper Jos Buttler and Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan.

267.title: No curfew relaxation in MP's Khargone on Eid, Akshaya Tritiya
267.article_body: The administration in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone decided not to relax the curfew on Tuesday and asked people to celebrate Eid-ul-Fitr and Akshaya Tritiya at home. The decision has been taken with the consent of people from all communities, the administration stated. Parts of Khargone have been under curfew since April 10, when communal violence erupted during a Ram Navami procession.

268.title: The day you love yourself, people will helplessly fall for you: Tejasswi
268.article_body: Sharing her opinion on body positivity, actress Tejasswi Prakash said, "Body positivity is something...I very strongly encourage. If you want to be this person who is loved, start with loving yourself." "The day you love yourself for the way you are, people will helplessly fall for you," added Tejasswi. "Love's...not about how beautiful you look from the outside," stated Tejasswi.

269.title: Punjab land of martyrs; seeds of hatred don't bloom here: CM Mann
269.article_body: CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said that Punjab is a land of gurus and martyrs, adding that seeds of hatred don't bloom in the state. "Punjab's social bonding is very strong. We live in brotherhood and those who spread hatred find no place here," he said. Mann added the people will see a more vibrant Punjab in the coming years.

270.title: All will be well if power is given to people: Ghulam Nabi Azad on J&K polls
270.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Tuesday said "all would be well" if elections are held in Jammu and Kashmir. "If election happens and...power is given in...hands of people, then I believe all will be well," he said. Notably, Home Minister Amit Shah had earlier said that elections will be held in the Union Territory following the delimitation process.

271.title: 198 birds suffer heatstroke in Gurugram; hospitalised
271.article_body: As many as 198 birds have been hospitalised in Gurugram due to heatstroke. Giving details, Dr Rajkumar of Gurugram's Charitable Bird Hospital said, "Since the beginning of last week of April, the cases of heatstroke in birds have increased." As per India Meteorological Department (IMD), the north Indian region has been reeling under an intense heatwave for weeks now.

272.title: Motion in Canada Parliament to declare Nov as Hindu Heritage Month
272.article_body: An Indo-Canadian lawmaker, Chandra Arya, has moved a motion in Canada's Parliament to declare November as Hindu Heritage Month. The motion calls to "recognise the contributions that Hindu-Canadians have made to the socio-economic development of Canada…the richness of Hindu Heritage and its vast contribution to the world of arts and science...and its culture and traditions."

273.title: PM Modi arrives in Denmark, Danish PM receives him at Copenhagen airport
273.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday arrived in Denmark's Copenhagen on the second leg of his visit to three European nations. The PM was received at the Copenhagen airport by his Danish counterpart Mette Frederiksen. PM Modi is scheduled to hold talks with Frederiksen and attend the second India-Nordic Summit. He is also slated to visit Danish Queen Margrethe II.

274.title: Thar is Harsh Varrdhan's film, we're just supporting actors: Anil on son
274.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Thar', with actor Anupam Kher, actor Anil Kapoor said, "It's a different kind of movie. The trailer has received a good response." Anupam then said, "Harsh ki film hai (It's Harsh's film)." Reiterating the same statement, Anil said, "Harsh ki film hai. Hum to...supporting actors hain (It's Harsh's film. We're just supporting actors)."

275.title: Home Minister Amit Shah pays tribute to Lingayat saint Basaveshwara in B'luru
275.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah paid floral tributes to the bust and statue of Lingayat saint Basaveshwara on his birth anniversary as he arrived in Bengaluru on Tuesday. Tweeting photos from the event, Shah hailed the saint and wrote, "He devoted his entire life to the service of humanity...His great teachings on harmony, brotherhood and compassion...continue to guide us."

276.title: Referring to people around, not those behind devices: Nimrat on weight gain post
276.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur said that it wasn't online trolls who spoke about her weight gain during shooting of 'Dasvi'. "It was something...I experienced personally in day-to-day life...I am referring to people who were around me...not those who are hiding behind gadgets," she added. She also said that such people have been conditioned to feel they can say anything to anyone.

277.title: Rahul & Priyanka Gandhi do part-time politics: BJP's Rajyavardhan
277.article_body: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi do part-time politics, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore said on Tuesday. "Rajasthan government is useless. Do as many press conferences or give as many justifications about his (Rahul Gandhi) partying as you want, why is your government not working on its responsibilities?" Rathore added.

278.title: Tanushree Dutta gets stitches after accident due to brake failure, shares pic of injury
278.article_body: Actress Tanushree Dutta recently met with a road accident on her way to a temple. Taking to Instagram, she revealed that the accident took place after the vehicle she was travelling in had a brake failure. "Got away with just a few stitches," Tanushree further wrote while sharing a photo of her injury.

279.title: Israel supports 'neo-Nazi regime' in Ukraine: Russia amid Hitler row
279.article_body: Russia on Tuesday accused Israeli government of supporting "neo-Nazi regime in Kyiv", a day after the latter denounced Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov's comparison of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy with Adolf Hitler. Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid had termed Lavrov's remarks as "unforgivable". Lavrov in an interview claimed that like Zelenskyy, "Hitler also had Jewish blood".

280.title: Activision shares rise after Buffett reveals owning 9.5% stake
280.article_body: Shares of Activision Blizzard rose nearly 3% on Monday after billionaire investor Warren Buffett said his company Berkshire Hathaway owned a 9.5% stake worth $5.6 billion in the video game maker. Activision shares were up $2.13, or 2.8%, at $77.73. However, this was still lower than the $95/share Microsoft offered as part of its $68.7 billion proposal to buy Activision.

281.title: 25-yr-old man killed, 3 injured as relatives clash at a wedding in UP
281.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and three others were injured after a clash broke out between relatives and friends of the bride and the groom at a wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra. Police said some guests of the groom allegedly misbehaved with female dancers at around 10 pm on Monday. The bride's side objected to this, leading to a fight.

282.title: If a wicket falls in 11th over, RR need to get Hetmyer out there: Gavaskar
282.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has questioned RR's decision to send Shimron Hetmyer only after the loss of four wickets against KKR on Monday. "The man is in form, even if a wicket falls in the 11th over, get him out there," stated Gavaskar. Hetmyer came in to bat in the 18th over and smashed 27*(13) to help RR post 152/5.

283.title: Man held over 2 months after rape victim's body was found in shop in Delhi
283.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping and killing a 14-year-old girl in Delhi's Narela on February 12, police said. The victim's partially decomposed body was earlier found under a heap of cow dung cakes kept in gunny bags in a shop, police added. Before his arrest, the accused fired at the police, DCP (Outer North) said.

284.title: The love for MS Dhoni is unreal, Pune was on fire for him: Pooran
284.article_body: SRH wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran took to Instagram to share that the love for MS Dhoni is "unreal", adding it's "absolutely electrifying" when Dhoni is in the stadium. "Pune was on fire for him," stated Pooran in his post. The Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune hosted the IPL 2022 match between SRH and CSK which SRH lost by 13 runs.

285.title: Non-bailable warrant issued against Raj Thackeray in 14-yr-old case in Maha
285.article_body: A court in the Sangli district of Maharashtra has issued a non-bailable warrant against MNS chief Raj Thackeray for allegedly making inflammatory speeches in 2008. The Judicial Magistrate issued the warrant against Thackeray and his party colleague Shirish Parkar. The court has asked Mumbai Police to implement the warrant before June 8 and produce both the leaders before the court.

286.title: Charak oath was our decision: TN medical college student council head
286.article_body: The student council president of the government-run medical college in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has said that the council had decided to administer 'Charak Shapath' instead of Hippocratic oath to first-year students. The council's president added that this was done "as it was recommended by the National Medical Commission". Furthermore, the council said that the college wasn't responsible for the act.

287.title: T'gana HC orders IAS officer to refund ₹15 lakh to govt over defamation case
287.article_body: The Telangana High Court has directed an IAS officer to refund ₹15 lakh sanctioned to her by the state government for meeting legal expenses in a defamation case against an English magazine. The court noted that it is a case where the IAS officer had participated in a private event, and asked her to pay the amount within 90 days.

288.title: Fans mistake Met Gala attendee wearing silver bodysuit for actor Jared Leto
288.article_body: Several fans mistook entrepreneur and self-proclaimed fashion addict Fredrik Robertsson for actor Jared Leto after he arrived at Met Gala. He wore a silver Iris van Herpen jumpsuit. "I love Jared Leto but this outfit confuses me," a Twitter user wrote. "Jared Leto...literally is one of like 5 men who actually does more than a black suit," another tweet read.

289.title: Indian wives possessive about husbands, jolt for them if he's shared by another lady: HC
289.article_body: Hearing a case of a man accused of abetting wife's suicide, Allahabad High Court's Justice Rahul Chaturvedi observed, "[Indian wives] are literally possessive about their husband. It'd be a biggest jolt for any married woman that her husband is being shared by some other lady." The man's wife had died by suicide allegedly because he was marrying another woman.

290.title: Tech blogger shares a glimpse of what Twitter's edit button could look like
290.article_body: Jane Manchun Wong, known for finding hidden features in companies' code, shared a glimpse of what she claims Twitter's edit button could look like. The Edit Tweet button allows users to create a new tweet with different content and a label saying 'Edited' appears at the bottom of edited tweet. Currently, users will have 30 minutes to make tweet edits.

291.title: Assistant loco pilot delays train by an hour after he goes for drinking in Bihar
291.article_body: A local train in Bihar was held up for nearly an hour on Monday after the assistant loco pilot went missing. He was eventually tracked down by the government railway police (GRP) but he was too drunk to get back to the train, Hindustan Times reported. Samastipur divisional railway manager Alok Agarwal said he has sought a detailed report.

292.title: Rohit Roy to star in Sam Bhattacharjee's Indo-British sci-fi film 'IRaH'
292.article_body: Actor Rohit Bose Roy is set to make his international debut with a sci-fi thriller, titled 'IRaH'. The upcoming film, an Indo-British production, will be directed by Sam Bhattacharjee. Rohit will play a manipulative, narcissistic CEO of a tech company, who creates an AI-based application - IRaH 5.10, through which a person can effectively achieve immortality by archiving oneself.

293.title: Smriti Irani visits Rahul Gandhi's constituency Wayanad to review development
293.article_body: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani reached Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha constituency Wayanad in Kerala to review developmental projects in the district. Prior to her arrival in Wayanad, Irani took to Twitter and said, "Hello Wayanad! I will be there soon to attend meetings and other public events related to the development of the district."

294.title: Govt sets 19-million-tonnes coal import target for end-June: Report
294.article_body: The Centre has asked state and private-sector power utilities to ensure delivery of 19 million tonnes of coal from overseas by end-June, Reuters reported citing a letter from the Power Ministry. Public-sector utilities have been asked to import over 22 million tonnes of coal, while private-sector utilities have been asked to import a total of 15.94 million tonnes of coal.

295.title: PMPML starts e-bus services to Sinhagad fort, two-way fare at ₹100
295.article_body: PMPML commenced e-bus services to the Sinhagad fort on Monday, a day after it was inaugurated by Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar. The buses will pick up people from the foothills of the fort and its two-way fares have been fixed at ₹100 for adults and ₹50 for children. Private vehicles won't be allowed on hilltop to curb parking issues.

296.title: Masked men enter school and beat students in Gurugram
296.article_body: Masked men entered a school in Gurugram's Abhaypur village and assaulted students of Class 12 with sticks on Monday, according to the police. Nine students, including five girls, were admitted to a hospital after the incident, the police said. "As per the complaint of the teacher, an FIR has been registered against 15 accused," a police official said.

297.title: The one & only: Kareena on Natasha Poonawalla's Met Gala 2022 look
297.article_body: Indian businesswoman Natasha Poonawalla attended Met Gala 2022 event and donned a golden saree with a bustier. Her golden look for the event, which was designed by Sabyasachi Mukherjee and the house of Schiaparelli, received praises from actors Kareena Kapoor, Karisma Kapoor and Malaika Arora. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kareena wrote, "The one and only. Ufffff. Love love love."

298.title: Way Rinku maintained his calm under pressure vs RR was outstanding: Shreyas
298.article_body: Praising Rinku Singh for his unbeaten 23-ball 42, which includes six fours and one six, in KKR's seven-wicket win against RR in IPL 2022, KKR skipper Shreyas Iyer said the 24-year-old batter showed "outstanding" calmness under pressure. "He's a great asset for the future in...franchise," he added. Rinku and Nitish Rana (48*) helped KKR chase 153-run target in 19.1 overs.

299.title: Rahul parties more & works less: BJP's Shahnawaz on viral video
299.article_body: After a video went viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at a nightclub in Kathmandu, BJP leader Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said Gandhi parties more and works less for his party. "He parties every day, no one stops him anyway," Hussain added. "The Constitution doesn't have any such rule where anyone can be stopped from partying," Hussain stated.

300.title: 1 killed as speeding 2-wheeler hits scooty, Cyberabad Police shares video
300.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police has shared a video showing a speeding two-wheeler crashing into a scooter on Nalsar Cross Road in Shamirpet. The pillion rider lost his life, the police said, adding that he was not wearing a helmet. The police cautioned the citizens against abruptly changing lane and over speeding.

301.title: 3 men rob 23-yr-old taxi driver of his vehicle, cash in Ludhiana
301.article_body: Three men impersonated as passengers and robbed a 23-year-old taxi driver of his vehicle and ₹2,000 cash in Ludhiana. The accused threatened the taxi driver with sharp-edged weapons on the national highway near Ladhowal on Sunday. An FIR has been registered against the unidentified accused persons. Police are scanning closed-circuit television cameras to trace the accused.

302.title: Amit Shah lays foundation stone for Nrupathunga University in B'luru
302.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for the Nrupathunga University in Bengaluru. He also virtually inaugurated the Forensic Science Laboratory in Ballari. "Under PM Modi's leadership, we're building infra for higher education," Shah said. "In the journey of 75 years, the country has crossed a lot of destinations and we're standing here today," he added.

303.title: Cong responds after Rahul seen at nightclub, says 'attending wedding part of our culture'
303.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala has responded to criticism after Rahul Gandhi was seen at a nightclub in Kathmandu, saying that Rahul went to Nepal to attend the wedding of a friend, who is a journalist. "Last I checked, having family and friends and attending marriage ceremonies is a matter of our culture and civilisation," Surjewala said.

304.title: Russia plans to annex parts of eastern Ukraine: US
304.article_body: The US has warned that Moscow is planning to formally annex parts of eastern Ukraine, specifically the regions of Luhansk and Donetsk, later this month. Russia also has a similar plan for Kherson region, Michael Carpenter, US ambassador to the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, said. Neither move would be recognised by America or its allies, he added.

305.title: CCTV footage of Chennai police chasing alleged custodial death victim surfaces
305.article_body: Days after a 25-year-old man died due to alleged custodial torture by police personnel in Chennai, a CCTV footage purportedly showing policemen chasing and beating him has surfaced online. The deceased's brother earlier claimed that police had offered their family money in an attempt to cover up the truth. Police had claimed that the man died due to a seizure.

306.title: We will not support sanctions on Russian oil & gas: Hungary
306.article_body: Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto on Tuesday said that Hungary will not support the European Union's sanctions that would make Russian oil and gas shipments to the country impossible. Russian oil shipments via the Druzhba pipeline account for about 65% of the oil Hungary needs and there are no alternative supply routes to replace that, he added.

307.title: Pune man cheats employees of ₹28 lakh provident fund money; booked
307.article_body: A security company's director in Pune's Bhosari has been booked for allegedly cheating his employees of ₹28.3 lakh by diverting funds from provident fund payments. The company allegedly deducted money from employees' salaries on pretext of provident fund deposits, however, the amount wasn't transferred to their EPFO accounts. The director has been accused of using the money for personal needs.

308.title: Camila, Shawn make solo appearances at Met Gala 2022 post break up
308.article_body: Former couple Camila Cabello and Shawn Mendes attended the Met Gala 2022 separately. Shawn walked the red carpet wearing a navy and burgundy suit jacket, while Camila donned a white lace-up crop top paired with a full skirt. Pictures of the duo, making solo appearances surfaced online. Commenting on them, a user wrote, "It was...September 2021 when they appeared together."

309.title: Over 200 civilians still trapped at Mariupol steel plant: Mayor
309.article_body: The Mayor of Ukraine's Mariupol, Vadym Boychenko, has said that over 200 civilians are still trapped at the Azovstal steel plant in the city. This comes after several Ukrainians were rescued in a United Nations-led evacuation mission on Monday. A Ukrainian fighter has also made a similar claim saying that women, children and elderly people couldn't be rescued.

310.title: Less than 5% of users are fake or spam accounts: Twitter
310.article_body: False or spam accounts represented less than 5% of Twitter's 229 million monetisable daily active users in Q1, the company estimated in a filing. This comes after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, said one of his priorities will be to remove "spam bots" from Twitter. Around 48% of Musk's Twitter followers are fake, TIME magazine recently reported.

311.title: Police constable injured in encounter with Naxals in Maharashtra
311.article_body: A police constable suffered serious injuries in an encounter with Naxals in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district on Tuesday, a senior official said. The encounter broke out when a team of C-60 commandos, a specialised combat unit of Gadchiroli police, was patrolling in the area. The Naxals opened fire at the police patrolling team, following which the security personnel retaliated.

312.title: Sexual exploitation of people in film industry is so common: Kangana
312.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, while hosting the reality show 'Lock Upp', said sexual exploitation of young people in the film and fashion industry is common. "While it gives so many opportunities, it also shatters many dreams and leaves people permanently scarred. It is the dark truth," Kangana added. Earlier, Kangana had revealed she was inappropriately touched when she was a child.

313.title: Data based on Centre's NPP: Satyendar Jain to Union Minister on 'wrong figures' remark
313.article_body: Responding to Union Power Minister RK Singh's claim that the coal stock data presented by Satyendar Jain had "incorrect" figures, the Delhi Power Minister said that the figures were taken from portal managed by Centre. The figures mentioned in my letter for some of the NTPC stations were based on daily coal report of National Power Portal, Jain said.

314.title: Curfew imposed in 10 areas in Jodhpur after clashes break out between 2 groups
314.article_body: Rajasthan's Jodhpur district administration has imposed a curfew from 1 pm on Tuesday till midnight on Wednesday in 10 police station areas. Internet services have also been suspended in Jodhpur. This comes after a stone-pelting incident and clashes between two communities at Jalori Gate broke out on Monday night. During the violence, many people were injured, including four police personnel.

315.title: Meghana remembers Chiranjeevi Sarja on wedding anniversary, pens note
315.article_body: Actress Meghana Raj Sarja took to Instagram on Monday to pen a note remembering her late husband, Chiranjeevi Sarja, on the occasion of their wedding anniversary. "The only reason I will ever forgive God is because I know he needs your guidance to make sure he does the right thing to Raayan (son) and me...Happy anniversary," Meghana wrote.

316.title: It's a bad precedent for Indian cricket: Ajay Jadeja on KKR dropping Venkatesh
316.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has criticised KKR for dropping all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer for their match against RR. "There will always be a debate regarding selection. But if you start dropping players of the Indian team after just a handful of matches then you'll set a bad precedent," he stated. Iyer has scored 132 runs in nine matches so far.

317.title: Explosion at Pune eatery due to leaked LPG, 2 workers injured
317.article_body: Two workers of an eatery were injured in an explosion caused by leaked liquified petroleum gas (LPG) used for cooking in Pune district's Chinchwad area on Tuesday. The LPG cylinder did not explode, an official said. The incident took place at around 9 am when several people were having breakfast at the eatery.

318.title: 4000-kg sword for ₹85-crore Kempegowda statue arrives at B'luru airport
318.article_body: A 4,000-kilogram sword, which is part of the 108-foot-tall Kempegowda statue being constructed at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport premises, arrived in a special truck from Delhi on Monday. Karnataka minister Ashwathnarayan CN welcomed the 35-foot-long sword and participated in a 'shakti puja' conducted by priests on the occasion. The statue is estimated to cost ₹85 crore.

319.title: KKR's Rinku shows he wrote 50 & heart on palm before Man of the Match performance vs RR
319.article_body: After winning the Man of the Match for his 42*(23) against RR, KKR batter Rinku Singh, in a video shared by IPL, showed he had scribbled 50 and heart sign on his palm ahead of the match. "I had a feeling since morning that I'll score runs and be Man of the Match...which is why I wrote this," Rinku said.

320.title: Let's win COVID battle like Harry Potter defeated Voldemort: Delhi Police
320.article_body: Amid the rise in COVID-19 cases in the national capital, Delhi Police shared a tweet on COVID-19 awareness."There is a surge in #COVID19 cases. Delhi Police urges everyone to mask up, maintain social distancing & avoid crowds. Let's work together to keep Delhi safe and win this battle just like #HarryPotter defeated Voldemort. Happy #HarryPotterDay!" the tweet read.

321.title: World's richest man Musk walks Met Gala red carpet with his supermodel mother
321.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk walked the Met Gala 2022 red carpet with his 74-year-old supermodel mother Maye Musk. On being asked why the world's richest man would make time for Met Gala, Musk responded, "My mom wanted to come, so I brought my mom. That's the reason." Elon wore a black tuxedo while Maye wore a Dior gown.

322.title: Will take action against Raj Thackeray today itself: Maha DGP
322.article_body: Maharashtra DGP Rajnish Seth said action will be taken against MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday itself based on his speech calling for removal of loudspeakers from mosques. "Aurangabad Commissioner is looking into the speech. He'll take whatever legal action that is needed," Seth said. We're prepared to deal with issues arising out of Thackeray's call for agitation, he added.

323.title: 19-year-old Stanford dropouts' Zepto raises $200 mn at $900 mn valuation
323.article_body: Ten-minute grocery delivery startup Zepto, founded by childhood friends Aadit Palicha and Kaivalya Vohra who dropped out of Stanford University, has raised $200 million in Series D round led by Y Combinator. The nine-month-old startup of Palicha and Vohra, both 19 years old, is now valued at $900 million. In its Series C round, Zepto was valued at $570 million.

324.title: Not a crime to attend friend's marriage: Surjewala on BJP criticising Rahul
324.article_body: After BJP leaders criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for being at a nightclub, the latter party's leader Randeep Surjewala said that Rahul was attending the marriage function of a journalist friend in Nepal and it's still "not a crime" to do so. "Maybe after today, BJP may decide it's illegal to attend...marriage and a crime to have friends," he added.

325.title: Kidnappers using civilians as human shields: Nigeria Prez on train attack
325.article_body: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said that the armed gangs, who kidnapped dozens of people in a train attack weeks ago, were using civilians as human shields. It is causing difficulties for the military to conduct rescue operation, he said. "It's a delicate situation...Any rescue operation that results in the death of any hostage cannot be deemed a success," he added.

326.title: Model Cara Delevingne reveals her gold painted body at Met Gala, pics go viral
326.article_body: Supermodel Cara Delevingne showed up at the Met Gala red carpet in a red Dior Haute Couture suit and removed the jacket to reveal her naked torso covered in gold body paint. She wore a gold body chain that matched her body paint and she also partly covered her breasts. The theme for this year's Met Gala was 'Gilded Glamour'.

327.title: Kohli would be fuming that his 58 (53) wasn't enough to beat GT: Pietersen
327.article_body: Ex-RCB captain Kevin Pietersen said Virat Kohli would be "fuming" about his 53-ball 58 not being enough to help RCB beat GT in their IPL 2022 match. GT defeated RCB by six wickets. "I know Kohli is a champion [and]...a winner," added Pietersen. Kohli has scored 186 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 116.25.

328.title: BSF, Pak Rangers personnel exchange sweets on Eid at Attari border
328.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) and Pakistan Rangers personnel exchanged sweets at the JCP Attari border in Punjab on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr as part of the countries' traditions. They shook hands and greeted each other on the occasion. Personnel of the border guarding forces have been traditionally exchanging sweets on religious and national festivals of the two countries.

329.title: US Supreme Court set to strike down abortion rights: Report
329.article_body: The US Supreme Court appears set to vote to overturn the Roe v. Wade decision that legalised abortion nationwide, according to a leaked initial draft majority opinion published by Politico on Monday. "Roe was egregiously wrong from the start," conservative Justice Samuel Alito wrote in the draft opinion which is dated February 10, according to Politico.

330.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 more accused in Jahangirpuri violence case
330.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday arrested two more accused in connection with the communal violence that broke out in northwest Delhi's Jahangirpuri on April 16. One of the accused was seen distributing swords to the crowd in the footage from CCTV cameras, police said. Police have arrested a total of 33 people, including three juveniles, in the case so far.

331.title: 2 passengers run over by speeding train near Vapi station in Gujarat
331.article_body: Two passengers died after being run over by a speeding train near Vapi railway station in Gujarat's Valsad district, officials said. The incident occurred on Monday night when the deceased, who were relatives, were trying to board a Patna-bound train. They were run over by another train as they were crossing from the wrong side, an official said.

332.title: Protest at Pune university against Maha's decision on offline exams
332.article_body: Many students on Monday held a protest at Savitribai Phule Pune University against the Maharashtra government's decision to hold summer examinations in offline mode at universities across the state. Maharashtra NSUI President Amir Shaikh said that if "70% of the syllabus" was taught online then exams should also be online. Following this, SPPU Registrar Prafulla Pawar spoke to the students.

333.title: EC sends notice to Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren over mine lease
333.article_body: Election Commission (EC) on Monday issued a notice to Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren in connection with the mine lease case. EC has sought an explanation on why action should not be taken against him for allegedly having a mining lease issued in his favour. Prima-facie, Soren has violated Section 9A of the Representation of People's Act, EC stated.

334.title: 3 men returning from wedding function in UP die as bus hits motorcycle
334.article_body: Three men, who were returning from a wedding, were killed after a bus hit their motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Basti. The incident took place on the Lucknow-Gorakhpur national highway 28. The deceased have been identified as 20-year-old Niraj and Sandeep and 19-year-old Anil. The bodies have been sent for postmortem.

335.title: Jharkhand MLA Saryu Roy booked for allegedly leaking secret documents
335.article_body: Jharkhand Independent MLA Saryu Roy has been booked for allegedly leaking secret documents, an officer said on Tuesday. The FIR was lodged against the Jamshedpur (East) MLA by Under Secretary of state health department Vijay Varma. This comes almost three weeks after Roy accused state Health Minister Banna Gupta of corruption by misappropriating COVID-19 funds.

336.title: Researchers develop an enzyme that breaks down plastic in hours, not decades
336.article_body: Researchers have developed an enzyme that breaks down plastic waste in hours instead of decades at ambient temperatures. Developed from a natural PETase that allows bacteria to degrade plastic, the enzyme is named FAST-PETase (functional, active, stable and tolerant PETase). As per researchers, this enzyme breaks plastic down into its basic molecular units, which can be recycled into new products.

337.title: Pregnant Rihanna honoured with a statue at Met Gala 2022, pic surfaces
337.article_body: Singer Rihanna, who is pregnant, has been honoured with a marble statue by New York City's The Metropolitan Museum of Art at Met Gala 2022. The statue has been inspired by Rihanna's cover picture for Vogue US' May edition. "Shut down the met in marble...what’s more gilded than that? Lol...Thank you...for this historic tribute...y’all bad for this one!" Rihanna wrote

338.title: Dad fed & cleaned her, I'm sure he cried secretly: Namrata on mom Nargis' cancer
338.article_body: Sunil Dutt and Nargis' daughter Namrata recalled the time when her family had to move to the US during her mother's cancer treatment. "Dad was with her every single day from morning to night. He would feed her, clean her," she said. "I'm sure he cried secretly but dad never let us know what he was going through," added Namrata.

339.title: He hasn't done anything with either bat or ball: Gavaskar on Venkatesh
339.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer hasn't done anything with either bat or ball in IPL 2022 so far. "It could be a second season syndrome," added Gavaskar. Venkatesh has scored 132 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 97.77. He is yet to pick a wicket in IPL 2022.

340.title: BP, diabetes no grounds to refuse cancer cover: B'luru court to insurance firm
340.article_body: A Bengaluru court asked a private insurance firm to pay ₹6.7 lakh to a 60-year-old cancer patient to whom the firm denied insurance cover for cancer treatment on grounds that he had hypertension and diabetes. Hypertension and diabetes are not diseases but common physical disorders and they cannot be grounds to deny medical insurance, the court said.

341.title: Pregnant women with COVID-19 may be at risk of premature birth: Study
341.article_body: COVID-19 during pregnancy may lead to an increased risk of adverse maternal outcomes, ICU admissions, hospitalisations and preterm birth, a Canadian study has found. As per the study, these risks increase with age as well as comorbidities like high blood pressure.  The study, however, found that women who are fully vaccinated have a lower risk of experiencing these outcomes.

342.title: Justin Lin quit Fast X after 'major disagreement' with Vin Diesel: Report
342.article_body: Director Justin Lin quit 'Fast X' after a "major disagreement" with actor-producer Vin Diesel over script changes, according to a report. "Justin...had enough and said, 'This movie isn't worth my mental health,'" report quoted a source as saying. A Universal spokesperson, however, said that "any creative differences leading to Justin's exit were with studio, not with fellow producers or cast".

343.title: Man jailed for domestic violence, abetting wife's suicide in Hyd
343.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday said that a man has been imprisoned for three years on charges of domestic violence and abetting his wife's suicide. Rachakonda's Police Commissioner and Additional Police Commissioner appreciated the efforts of officials in convicting the accused and announced rewards for them, police added. The man reportedly harassed the deceased mentally and physically.

344.title: Australian man jailed for 12 yrs for murdering gay American man in 1988
344.article_body: A 51-year-old Australian man was sentenced to 12 years and seven months in prison for pushing and killing a gay American, Scott Johnson, off a Sydney cliff in 1988. Scott White was given a non-parole period of eight years and three months. Justice Helen Wilson said she didn't find beyond reasonable doubt that the murder was a gay hate crime.

345.title: 2 women, including friend, sedate & rob woman of ₹4 lakh jewellery in B'luru
345.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Bengaluru was robbed of ₹4 lakh jewellery by two women, one of whom she claimed to be her friend. According to the complainant, on April 27, the duo turned up at her home and gave her a drink laced with sedatives, making her unconscious. They then stole her chain and other ornaments from the house.

346.title: PBKS' vehicle is always in 5th gear, they refuse to shift down: Pragyan Ojha
346.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said the Mayank Agarwal-led side is losing matches because of their over-aggressive approach in IPL 2022. “Their vehicle is always in fifth gear, they refuse to shift down to fourth gear...They need to play as per the game situation,” he added. PBKS are eighth on IPL points table with five defeats in nine games.

347.title: Censor Board wanted to ban Sarfarosh, remove words 'Pakistan', 'ISI': Director
347.article_body: Filmmaker John Matthew said that censors wanted to ban his film 'Sarfarosh' and felt it was going against the very concept of trying to be friendly with Pakistan. "Censor Board members wanted me to remove the word 'Pakistan' and 'ISI' from film...I was ready to go even to the Supreme Court...I stood my ground...(It) was released with words," he said.

348.title: One day I lost my mind after getting out, went to Marine Drive during the match: Samson
348.article_body: Cricketer Sanju Samson revealed he once lost his mind after getting out during a match, adding that he threw his bat in dressing room and left the stadium. "I walked out to Marine Drive and sat there looking at sea and thought, 'What's going on?'" Sanju added. He further said that he returned to the stadium after the match finished.

349.title: 28-yr-old woman slips on road, gets crushed under petroleum truck in Pune
349.article_body: A 28-year-old woman, who was riding a two-wheeler, was killed after getting crushed by a petroleum tanker truck near the Magarpatta area in Pune's Hadapsar. The woman had slipped on the road when the tanker came and mowed her further down, police said. The rear tyre of the petroleum truck grievously injured her and caused her instant death, police added.

350.title: PBKS cannot rely on any batter except Dhawan in tough situations: Tahir
350.article_body: Former CSK spinner Imran Tahir said PBKS cannot rely on any other batter except opener Shikhar Dhawan in challenging situations, terming it as a concern for the team. "If we remove Dhawan, no other batter has shown consistency," added Tahir. Dhawan has scored 307 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 126.33.
