351.title: Aligarh Dharma Sabha organisers get notice over anti-minority remarks
351.article_body: The organisers of a religious event - Sanatan Dharma Sabha - held at Aligarh's Ramlila Ground were served with a show-cause notice by the district administration over remarks made against a minority community. The event was attended by religious leaders Yati Narsinghanand and Kalicharan Maharaj. The notice mentioned swords being brandished at the event despite a ban on carrying weapons.

352.title: Rahul Gandhi seen at nightclub in Kathmandu; video goes viral
352.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at a nightclub in Kathmandu. According to The Kathmandu Post, Gandhi arrived in the city to attend the wedding of his Nepali friend Sumnima Udas, a former CNN correspondent. The daily also quoted former Nepali Ambassador to Myanmar Bhim Udas as saying that Gandhi was invited to his daughter's wedding.

353.title: GT have snatched wins when defeat seemed imminent: Ajay Jadeja
353.article_body: Talking about GT's success in IPL 2022, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said it's not a team that plans and plays as per a set pattern. "Whichever player comes in is expected to do what is best for the team and what he's capable of," he explained. "They snatched wins in two-three games where defeat seemed imminent," Jadeja further said.

354.title: Before election mode, BJP workers get 3-day vacation in Gujarat
354.article_body: BJP's Gujarat leadership has given its workers a three-day break, from May 2 to 4, to spend time with their families before switching to election mode for the upcoming Assembly polls. There are no party functions in Gujarat till May 5, a senior BJP leader said. The workers have been working relentlessly for the last two years, he added.

355.title: Thane man, son rape mentally challenged daughter since 2017, get 10 yrs jail
355.article_body: A POCSO court has sentenced a 52-year-old man and his 25-year-old son to ten years in jail for allegedly raping the man's mentally challenged daughter on several occasions since 2017, when she was 15-years-old. The girl had told her neighbours after she got pregnant. The court has also imposed a fine of ₹5000 on both accused.

356.title: We'll fulfil what entire nation wants: 'Sarabhai...' producer on new season
356.article_body: Speaking about making a new season of 'Sarabhai Vs Sarabhai', producer JD Majethia, said some more time is needed to make a new season. "I agree with fans, a new season should be made. We will make all the efforts. Everybody is ready to extend their efforts," he added. "What the entire nation wants, [we'll] fulfil their wishes," he said.

357.title: Biden would love to visit Ukraine, but no current plans: White House
357.article_body: White House spokesperson Jen Psaki on Monday said US President Joe Biden would "love to visit Ukraine", but there are no current plans for him to do so. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi paid a surprise visit to Ukraine. Psaki said the Biden administration wants to reopen US Embassy in Kyiv and have US diplomats on site.

358.title: Gujarat to mass promote Classes 1 to 8 students over pandemic
358.article_body: Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani announced on Monday that the state government has decided to mass promote students from Classes 1 to 8 regardless of marks due to the situation caused by the coronavirus pandemic. The notice said that although the second semester (annual) examinations have been completed in primary schools, the results will not affect the student's promotion.

359.title: Heatwave claims 25 lives in 2 months in Maha, highest deaths in Vidarbha
359.article_body: At least 25 people have died due to the heatwave in Maharashtra in two months which is the highest since 2016, state Health Department's Surveillance Officer Dr Pradeep Awate said. Vidarbha recorded the highest number of deaths at 15. "IMD said...there may be a respite from the heat as pre-monsoon showers are likely in many parts of Maharashtra," Awate added.

360.title: MP police buy bike for man delivering food on cycle; video surfaces
360.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Home Department on Monday shared a video of Indore's Vijay Nagar police station officers gifting a bike to a 22-year-old online food delivery service employee. The police had decided to do so after seeing the man use a bicycle to deliver food. "We came to know that [the man's] family is facing financial problems," an official said.

361.title: Bikers attack student with knife after hitting him outside school in Delhi
361.article_body: A biker and his pillion reportedly attacked a student in Delhi's Mangolpuri on Monday. The boy told police he got into an argument with the accused after he was accidentally hit by their bike outside school, following which they called two other people and attacked him with a knife. As per medical reports, he has been hospitalised with non-superficial injuries.

362.title: I miss him with every breath of mine: Gauahar Khan on her father Zafar
362.article_body: Talking about her father Zafar Ahmed Khan who passed away in 2021, actress Gauahar Khan said, "I miss him with every breath of mine. There's not a minute...I don't think about him." "We don't realise what loss means to someone else until it actually hits us. You can...sympathise with people but you cannot feel what they feel," added Gauahar.

363.title: Country’s atmosphere not good, we want unity: Mamata on Eid
363.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said the atmosphere of the country is not good. "Divide and rule policy is not good..Isolation policy is not good...We want unity," Banerjee added. She was addressing people at the Red Road in Kolkata on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. "We are not scared, we know how to fight," Banerjee stated.

364.title: Security tightened near Jalori gate, Jodhpur DCP appeals for peace
364.article_body: Vandita Rana, DCP of Jodhpur West, said police officials have been deployed near Jalori Gate and in front of the Eidgah after violence happened in the area on Monday. She said deployment has also been done on various major roads. Further, she said an appeal for peace has been made and that both groups have been cooperating with the police.

365.title: Error by a Citi trader briefly wipes out $315 billion from stocks in Europe
365.article_body: The sudden plunge in European shares which was driven by a brief crash in Nordic markets was caused by a single sell order trade by Citigroup, Reuters reported. Citigroup said one of their traders in London made an error while inputting a transaction. The sudden plunge in the market briefly wiped out $315 billion from European stocks.

366.title: Anil Kapoor has been a support system; we had an easy relationship: Fatima
366.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Anil Kapoor in 'Thar', his co-star, Fatima Sana Shaikh, said he has been like a support system to her in the Hindi film industry. She added that Anil would always encourage her whenever her morale was down. "We had a very easy relationship on...sets, it was...warm. I want to work with him again," Fatima said.

367.title: Rakul, Bhumi in talks for Arjun Kapoor's 'Meri Patni Ka Remake': Report
367.article_body: The makers of 'Meri Patni Ka Remake' are reportedly in advanced talks with Rakul Preet Singh and Bhumi Pednekar for the upcoming Arjun Kapoor-starrer film. As per report, the film will be directed by Mudassar Aziz, the filmmaker behind films like 'Pati Patni Aur Woh' and 'Happy Bhag Jayegi'. It'll reportedly go on floors in the second half of 2022.

368.title: Unidentified person impersonates Punjab & H’yana HC Chief Justice, booked
368.article_body: An unidentified person has been booked for allegedly impersonating Punjab and Haryana High Court Chief Justice, Ravi Shankar Jha and asking people for Amazon gift cards. According to the complainant, an office executive at Chandigarh Judicial Academy, the accused contacted him via WhatsApp on March 24 and asked him to send some Amazon gift cards.

369.title: You're creating enemies in your house by saying 'You're Tamilian, speak in Hindi': Sonu
369.article_body: Amid the national language debate, singer Sonu Nigam said, "Nowhere in the constitution it's written that Hindi is our national language." "You're creating enemies in your house by saying, 'You are Tamilian, you speak in Hindi'," Sonu added. He further asserted that nobody should be told what language to speak in, adding, "Let’s not divide people further in our country."

370.title: Religious issues being created to hide Centre's failures: Maha Cong chief
370.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Monday said religious controversies were being created in the country to hide the failures of the central government. The last eight years of BJP-led central government has led to inflation, unemployment and farm distress, Patole added. Further, while reacting to Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker removal demand, Patole said that no one is above the law.

371.title: US politician Laurie Cumbo's boyfriend proposes to her at Met Gala red carpet, pics viral
371.article_body: American politician Laurie Cumbo's boyfriend Bobby Digi Olisa proposed to her at red carpet of Met Gala 2022, which was held at Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City (NYC). "You wait for this moment your whole life almost and for it to be right here...it was everything I thought it'd be," Cumbo, who's NYC's cultural affairs commissioner, said.

372.title: Irrfan's son Babil to star in Farhan's web series Friday Night Plan: Report
372.article_body: Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan has reportedly bagged Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani's production venture 'Friday Night Plan'. According to the report, the web series, directed by Vatsal Neelakantan, went on floors over the weekend. Babil will make his acting debut with 'Qala' in which he will share screen space with Triptii Dimri and Swastika Mukherjee.

373.title: Russia has forgotten all the lessons of World War II: Zelenskyy
373.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov's suggestion that "Adolf Hitler had Jewish blood" shows "Russia has forgotten all the lessons of World War II or maybe they never studied those lessons". Zelenskyy, who is Jewish, made these comments in his nightly video address. Israel called Lavrov's comments "unforgivable" and demanded an apology from Moscow.

374.title: Hardik Patel removes 'working president of Gujarat Congress' from his Twitter bio
374.article_body: Congress' Hardik Patel has removed the mention of "working president of Gujarat Congress" from his Twitter bio amid reports that he is unhappy with the party. Patel's Twitter bio now reads "Proud Indian Patriot. Social and Political Activist". Earlier, Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor had said that Patel is not making himself available to resolve differences when invited for talks.

375.title: Uniform Civil Code is not required in India, says Owaisi
375.article_body: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi said that the Uniform Civil Code is not required in the country. "As per the Goa civil code, Hindu men have the right of second marriage if wife fails to deliver a male child by the age of 30. BJP has the government in that state too but they are silent over the matter," he stated.

376.title: US couple gets married midair aboard flight to Las Vegas; pics surface
376.article_body: Pam Patterson and Jeremy Salda got married aboard Southwest Airlines flight to Las Vegas after their original flight to the city got cancelled. As they boarded the plane, the pilot noticed they were wearing wedding dress and asked the bride about it. Patterson joked that they should just get married on the flight and the pilot said, "Let's do it!"

377.title: I have been waiting for last five years to get a chance: Rinku Singh
377.article_body: KKR's Rinku Singh, who was named Man of the Match for his unbeaten 42-run innings against RR, said he has been waiting for the last five years to get regular chances in IPL. "I'm the first [from Aligarh] to play in the IPL," he added. Rinku made his IPL debut in 2018 but has played only 13 games so far.

378.title: Right from powerplay, it was just the start we needed: Shreyas on win vs RR
378.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said they got just the start they needed after they conceded 38 runs in the powerplay and took a wicket during RR's innings on Monday. Shreyas also praised Sunil Narine, Umesh Yadav and Rinku Singh for their performances in the match as they won by seven wickets. KKR ended their five-match losing streak with the win.

379.title: Gujarat ATS seizes heroin worth ₹775 cr from house in UP's Muzaffarnagar
379.article_body: Gujarat Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS), in a joint operation with Delhi Police and Uttar Pradesh Police, on Monday seized around 155 kilograms of heroin worth ₹775 crore from a house in UP's Muzaffarnagar. Notably, the accused was earlier arrested by the Gujarat ATS after 35 kilograms of heroin was allegedly found from his factory premises in Muzaffarnagar.

380.title: Pune traffic officer gets award for saving 8-year-old girl's life
380.article_body: Pune City Police's Traffic Control branch officer, Naik Sameer, was conferred a bravery award by a social organisation for saving the life of an eight-year-old girl last month. Naik had picked up the girl, who'd been in a traffic accident, and ran to the hospital after realising that the ambulance may arrive late. An auto-rickshaw driver had also helped Naik.

381.title: Both Ram Charan & Jr NTR are electrifying: Anupam after watching RRR
381.article_body: On Monday, actors Anil Kapoor and Anupam Kher went to the theatre to watch 'RRR'. Sharing his review of the film on Twitter, actor Anupam Kher wrote, "Watched SS Rajamouli's #RRR. What an amazingly entertaining movie. High on content, performances, songs, dances and action sequences! Both Ram Charan and Jr NTR are electrifying. Loved the climax."

382.title: Bengaluru reports 103 new COVID-19 cases, zero deaths
382.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 103 new cases of COVID-19 as compared to Sunday, when the city reported 93 new cases. According to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, the city reported zero deaths and 73 new recoveries in the last 24 hours. Further, with 1,731 active cases, the positivity rate now stands at 3.89%, the civic body added.

383.title: IMD to launch 'Urban Meteorological Services' in 50 cities by 2023
383.article_body: The IMD will be launching the Urban Meteorological Services for over 50 cities by next year. "Urban meteorology processes are completely different from meteorology processes in countryside areas," an IMD official said. "In cities, there are urban heat islands which can play a contributory factor in regulating weather parameters, like temperature," another IMD official said.

384.title: Delhi airport 2nd busiest in March 2022; ahead of Dubai, London: Report
384.article_body: According to report by Official Airline Guide, Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport has emerged as world's second busiest in March this year, following Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport in Atlanta in United States, which is at number one. The report said Delhi airport saw 3.61 million seats booked this March. IGI Airport is followed by Dubai and London airports on list.

385.title: Shanghai resident sent to morgue alive; probe on
385.article_body: A resident of a nursing home in Shanghai was reportedly sent to the morgue alive in an apparent mistake which has prompted an investigation by the authorities and angry reactions from the netizens. The person was later sent to a hospital for treatment and was said to be stable. Four people, including the Director of the nursing home, were dismissed.

386.title: 2 teachers allegedly come to school drunk in H'yana; protest held
386.article_body: A government school in a village in Haryana's Jind was shut down as parents and students held a protest accusing two teachers of coming to work in an inebriated state and abusing children. A local said that the school's head had failed to take action against the teachers. The school gate was opened after block education officer reached the spot.

387.title: Woman loses ₹89 lakh as 33-yr-old poses as RAW agent, offers visa help
387.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested 33-year-old man for cheating a woman of ₹89 lakh after posing as a RAW agent and offering her help with visa. Woman said she met him on flight, where he offered to help her after her application for Italian and Czech Republic visas was rejected. She gave him ₹89 lakh in September 2021 but got no response.

388.title: Man who threw woman off moving train for resisting molestation held in MP
388.article_body: A 26-year-old man, who threw a 25-year-old woman off a moving train for resisting molestation bid near Khajuraho in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur in April, has been arrested. Police got leads from an unattended mobile phone from the spot, which belonged to the accused, an official said. The victim was returning home after visiting Bageshwar Dham temple, police had said earlier.

389.title: Student suicide cases on rise in Rajasthan's Kota, 4 deaths reported in a month
389.article_body: The number of suicide cases among students in Rajasthan's Kota has surged in the past few months as the city reported four such deaths in over 30 days time. On Monday, 18-year-old student Ranveer Singh, who was a resident of Bihar and had come to study in Kota a month ago, committed suicide. He was preparing for medical exams.

390.title: Ex-policeman found guilty of assaulting officer during US Capitol riot
390.article_body: An ex-New York City police officer was on Monday found guilty of assaulting a police officer during January 6, 2021, US Capitol riot. A federal jury in the District of Columbia rejected Thomas Webster's argument that he was acting in self-defence when he struck an officer with a flagpole and tackled him. The 56-year-old will be sentenced on September 2.

391.title: Maharashtra police beat up man for keeping shop open late at night
391.article_body: A man was allegedly beaten up by police officers in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for keeping his shop open late at night. A video of the incident has surfaced online. A police officer said that the man had refused and used abusive language when the officers asked him to shut his shop on noticing that it was open past 12.30 am.

392.title: Actress Blake Lively's Met Gala dress transforms from copper into aqua blue, pics viral
392.article_body: Actress Blake Lively wore a transforming dress at the Met Gala 2022, whose theme was 'In America: An Anthology of Fashion'. Lively wore a red-toned gown featuring a large bow. The actress' bow was untied after a while, unveiling a long blue train. "I arrived copper and then like New York City classic architecture, I patinaed," she said.

393.title: 4 students injured as plaster falls from school lobby roof in Gujarat
393.article_body: Four students of a government primary school in Gujarat's Mahisagar district were injured on Monday after cement plaster from the roof of lobby fell on them. The incident occurred during the farewell function of a retiring teacher. Along with students, their parents, villagers and school management committee members were also present, said District Primary Education Officer (DPEO) PN Modi.

394.title: Child trafficking racket busted in Lucknow, 2-year-old boy rescued
394.article_body: A child trafficking gang was busted by the Government Railway Police (GRP), Charbagh in Lucknow after a two-year-old baby was rescued from the possession of three alleged kidnappers. The three accused were arrested while a minor was detained. "The complainant is homeless and lives on the platform along with his three children, including the two-year-old baby," a police official said.

395.title: Ebola outbreak in DR Congo prompts high alert in Tanzania
395.article_body: Tanzania has been put on high alert following an Ebola outbreak in neighbouring Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), which has reportedly caused the death of two persons. The Tanzanian government said it has sent teams of surveillance experts to areas bordering DRC. "People should take precautionary measures as the government is working on the issue," said a government official.

396.title: Mom's skin turned dark; she saw herself, broke down: Daughter on Nargis' cancer
396.article_body: Late actress Nargis' daughter Namrata Dutt said that her mother "broke down" after she saw her reflection in mirror after her chemotherapy treatment after being diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. "Her skin had turned dark with chemotherapy. She had lost hair. She couldn't believe what she saw," Dutt said. She added that they talked to Nargis when she was in coma.

397.title: 40% of global real-time digital payments took place in India in 2021: PM
397.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing the Indian community in Germany's Berlin said of all the global real-time digital payments in 2021, 40% took place in India. "Almost 10,000 services of Central government, state government and local self-government have become available online," he added. "The way technology is being included in governance shows...new political will of the new India," PM stated.

398.title: For my son, Nadal is no longer no.1; Alcaraz is his favourite: Djokovic
398.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic said Spain's Carlos Alcaraz has replaced Rafael Nadal as his son Stefan's favourite player over the last month. "Alcaraz is a big star already. He's got the whole package. I really like him. I have so much respect for him," added Djokovic. "I have had some amazing battles with Nadal. It's always special," stated Djokovic.

399.title: PM Modi extends greetings on Eid-ul-Fitr, calls for brotherhood
399.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter on Monday to extend greetings on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. "Best wishes on Eid-ul-Fitr. May this auspicious occasion enhance the spirit of togetherness and brotherhood in our society," he tweeted. "May everyone be blessed with good health and prosperity," PM Modi added.

400.title: I was hiding inside my house for 2 weeks: Osaka on her media boycott
400.article_body: Discussing her decision to boycott post-match media duties in 2021, ex-world number one Naomi Osaka said, "I was really sad. I was...embarrassed. I was kind of hiding inside my house for like two weeks." "I didn't really know how to cope with it," added Osaka. "Even though I was...scared, I was happy with the choice that I made," stated Osaka.

401.title: BSNL, MTNL likely to switch to 4G by end of 2022: Devusinh Chauhan
401.article_body: The Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) and Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Limited (MTNL) are likely to switch to 4G network by the end of 2022, MoS for Communications, Devusinh Chauhan, said. Chauhan added that the 5G spectrum will be rolled out by December-end across India. "We are setting up the infrastructure for 5G spectrum, which will soon see auctions," Chauhan stated.

402.title: It split me open: Gwyneth Paltrow on losing her father at 30
402.article_body: Gwyneth Paltrow has revealed that she lost her father, Bruce Paltrow, to throat cancer when she was 30 years old. "When it first happened I never anticipated that it was possible to have a feeling like that. It was not in my lexicon of emotions," she added. "It was so physical it felt like it split me open," Gwyneth said.
